content:
Telco Customer Experience Improvement

Project Overview

Objective:

The project aims to predict the best alternative cell tower for load diversion when an existing tower experiences an outage or fault. By leveraging connectivity patterns, distance, and performance history, the solution enables telecom providers to maintain uninterrupted service and improve customer experience.

Approach:

The methodology combines spatial and network-based analytics:

  1. Neighbor Identification â Find adjacent cell towers based on geographic distance.
  2. Connectivity Analysis â Evaluate neighboring towers based on historical connectivity and dropped call counts.
  3. Feature Engineering â Incorporate additional metrics such as signal strength, network load, and call success rates.
  4. Model Training â Train a linear optimization model that balances distance minimization with call quality maximization.
  5. Model Evaluation & Deployment â Validate predictions using connectivity success rates and deploy in real-time for tower outage scenarios.

Significance:

  • Ensures seamless connectivity during tower failures or maintenance.
  • Enhances customer satisfaction by reducing dropped calls.
  • Supports network resiliency by automating fallback tower selection.

Benefits:

  • Improved Call Quality: Reliable alternative tower selection reduces disruptions.
  • Higher Customer Retention: Better service quality enhances customer loyalty.
  • Operational Efficiency: Automated diversion reduces manual intervention in network management.
  • Proactive Network Management: Predictive insights improve network planning and capacity allocation.

Expected Outcomes:

  • Accurate prediction of the most suitable neighboring tower.
  • Analytical dashboards showing tower connectivity relationships and diversion outcomes.
  • Optimized call success rates during outages, contributing to better customer experience KPIs.
